wikipedia_page.main: Major Bernard Charles "Jock" Hartley OBE (16 March 1879 – 24 April 1960) was a rugby union international player who represented England from 1901 to 1902. At club level he represented Cambridge University and Blackheath. In 1938 he was given the role of team manager of the British Isles team on their tour of South Africa.

response: In 1938, despite not being selected for his national team, he was chosen to tour South Africa as a part of Bernard Charles Hartley's British Isles team along with team-mate Clement. Clement had been a first choice selection, but Jones was a later choice following the withdrawal of Harlequins wing F.J.V. Ford.Hughes (1986) p.141 Despite playing in only 12 of the 24 matches of the tour, Jones finished as the tour's highest try scorer with ten, including the first British try against the South Africa team, in the third and final Test of the series. Twice in the tour he scored a hat-trick of tries, against the South Western Districts and then Rhodesia.
